articles.author: Nick Carey, Paul Lienert, Victoria Waldersee
articles.description: A little-publicized clause in the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act has companies scrambling to recycle electric vehicle batteries in North America, putting the region at the forefront of a global race to undermine China's dominance of the field.
articles.title: Focus: Dead EV batteries turn to gold with U.S. incentives

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Apollo Global Management Inc (APO.N) co-founder Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands to avoid any legal claims tied to a Jeffrey Epstein sex-trafficking investigation, the New York Times reported on Friday.
articles.title: Investor Leon Black settles with US Virgin Islands over Epstein probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: CME Group (CME.O), the world's largest derivatives exchange, eliminated about 100 positions, or 3% of its workforce, this week while reallocating some positions, a spokesperson said on Friday.
articles.title: CME Group to lay off 3% of its workforce, reallocate positions

articles.author: Siddhi Nayak
articles.description: Go Airlines (India) Ltd has received claims worth 240 billion rupees ($2.9 billion) from operational and financial creditors so far as part of the carrier's ongoing insolvency, two banking sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Go First gets claims worth $2.9 bln from creditors - sources

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Riddhima Talwani
articles.description: Some Subway India outlets have stopped serving tomatoes in their salads and sandwiches due to quality problems, the latest move by a foreign brand as prices of the staple have soared nearly 400% to record highs in the country.
articles.title: Some Subway India outlets drop tomatoes citing poor quality amid price surge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Energy on Friday proposed energy efficiency standards on water heaters it said would save consumers $11.4 billion on energy and water bills annually.
articles.title: US plans water heater standards, says they will save consumers $11 billion

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A federal appeals court on Friday said it will reconsider its recent decision that Tesla (TSLA.O) Chief Executive Elon Musk violated federal labor law by tweeting that employees would lose stock options if they joined a union.
articles.title: US appeals court to reconsider decision on Elon Musk tweet about unions

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: An internal report presented to Taiwan's president contained an alarming finding: In drones, the island lagged far behind its much more powerful adversary.
articles.title: Inspired by Ukraine war, Taiwan launches drone blitz to counter China

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Russia pounded Ukrainian food export facilities for a fourth day in a row on Friday and practised seizing ships in the Black Sea in an escalation of what Western leaders say is an attempt to wriggle out of sanctions by threatening a global food crisis.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine's grain, UN warns of hunger from price rises

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Brad Brooks
articles.description: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris criticized Florida "extremists" on Friday for backing educational guidelines that taught "revisionist history" about slavery in the United States.
articles.title: US VP Harris blasts Florida 'extremists' over education guidelines about slavery
